com.st.st25sdk.command

Interface Iso15693CustomCommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Iso15693CustomCommand

    public interface Iso15693CustomCommandInterface
    Defines the methods to build STMicroelectronics ISO15693 custom commands

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] checkEHEn(byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Check EHEn command as defined in M24LR specification Read Energy Harvesting register (command code 0xA3)
      byte[] enableEAS()
      Enable EAS command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag sends back EAS parameters (command code 0xA3)
      byte enableUntraceableMode(byte[] obfuscatedUntraceableModePassword)
      Enable Untraceable Mode command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will not respond to any command except Present Password and Get Random Number (command number 0xBA)
      byte[] fastExtendedReadMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress, byte[] nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Extended Read Multiple Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one or more extended memory blocks (command code 0xC5) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastExtendedReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress)
      Fast Extended Read Single Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one extended memory blocks (command code 0xC4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInitiate(byte flag)
      Fast Initiate command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag runs the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD2) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryInitiated(byte flag)
      Fast Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xC1) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte afiField)
      Fast Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xC1) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue)
      Fast Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xC1) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte afiField)
      Fast Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xC1) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryRead(byte flag, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryRead(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryRead(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte afiField, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastInventoryRead(byte flag, byte afiField, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastReadDynConfig(byte configId)
      Fast Read Dynamic Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read dynamic register (command code 0xCD) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastReadMsg(byte offset, byte sizeInBytes)
      Fast Read Message command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read message in the MailBox (command code 0xCC) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastReadMsgLength()
      Fast Read Message Length command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read message's length in the MailBox (command code 0xAB) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastReadMultipleBlock(byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Fast Read Multiple Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0xC3) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] fastReadSingleBlock(byte blockAddress)
      Fast Read Single Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one memory block (command code 0xC0) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte fastWriteDynConfig(byte configId, byte newAttributeValue)
      Fast Write Dynamic Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update a dynamic register (command code 0xCE) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte fastWriteMsg(byte sizeInBytes, byte[] buffer)
      Fast Write Message command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read message's length in the MailBox (command code 0xAB) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
      byte[] getRandomNumber()
      Get Random Number command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag returns a 16-bit random number (command code 0xB4)
      byte[] initiate(byte flag)
      Initiate command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag runs the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD2)
      byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag)
      Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
      byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte afiField)
      Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
      byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue)
      Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
      byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte afiField)
      Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
      byte[] inventoryRead(byte flag, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD3)
      byte[] inventoryRead(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD3)
      byte[] inventoryRead(byte flag, byte maskLengthInBits, byte[] maskValue, byte afiField, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD3)
      byte[] inventoryRead(byte flag, byte afiField, byte blockAddress, byte nbrOfBlocks)
      Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD3)
      byte kill(byte[] unencryptedKillCode)
      Kill command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will enter the Kill mute mode (command code 0xA6)
      byte lockEas()
      Lock EAS command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The EAS parameters will be definitively locked (command code 0xA4) WARNING This is irreversible
      byte lockKill()
      Lock Kill command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet This command locks the Kill password permanently (command code 0xB2) WARNING : this action is irreversible
      byte lockSector(byte blockAddress, byte securityStatus)
      Lock Sector command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Lock specified sector (command code 0xB2)
      byte manageGpo(byte value, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Manage GPO command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Depending on parameter, sends interrupt or force gpo value (command code 0xA9)
      byte presentPwd(byte passwordNumber, byte[] password)
      Present Password command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet In case of success, the security session associated to the password is opened (command code 0xB3)
      byte[] readCfg()
      Read Config command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read configuration register (command code 0xA0)
      byte[] readConfig(byte configId)
      Read Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read configuration register (command code 0xA0)
      byte[] readDynConfig(byte configId)
      Read Dynamic Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read dynamic register (command code 0xAD)

      byte[] readSignature()
      Read Signature command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read Electronic Signature (command code 0xDB)
      byte[] readSignature(byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read Signature command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read Electronic Signature (command code 0xDB)
      byte resetEas()
      Reset EAS command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet This command is used to deactivate the EAS feature (command code 0xA3)
      byte setEas()
      Set EAS command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet This command is used to activate the EAS feature (command code 0xA2)
      byte setRstEHEn(byte data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      SetRstEHEn command as defined in M24LR specification Enable (set) or Disable (reset) Energy Harvesting (command code 0xA2)
      byte writeConfig(byte configId, byte newAttributeValue)
      Write Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update a static configuration register (command code 0xA1)
      byte writeDOCfg(byte data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write DOCfg command as defined in M24LR specification Update Digital Output configuration register (command code 0xA4)
      byte writeDynConfig(byte configId, byte newAttributeValue)
      Write Dynamic Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update a dynamic register (command code 0xAE)
      byte writeEasConfig(byte config)
      Write EAS Configuration command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update the EAS configuration (command code 0xA8)
      byte writeEasId(byte[] easId)
      Write EAS Id command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update the EAS Id (command code 0xA7)
      byte writeEHCfg(byte data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write EHCfg command as defined in M24LR specification Update Energy Harvesting configuration register (command code 0xA1)
      byte writeKill(byte[] unencryptedKillPassword)
      Write Kill command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet This command updates the Kill password (command code 0xB1)
      byte writeMsg(byte sizeInBytes, byte[] buffer)
      Write Message command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update message in the Mailbox (command code 0xAA)
      byte writePwd(byte passwordNumber, byte[] newPassword)
      Write Password command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Update password value (command code 0xB1)

    • Method Detail

      • kill

        byte kill(byte[] unencryptedKillCode)
   throws STException
        Kill command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will enter the Kill mute mode (command code 0xA6)
        Parameters:
        unencryptedKillCode - transmitted Kill Code
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeKill

        byte writeKill(byte[] unencryptedKillPassword)
        throws STException

        Parameters:
        unencryptedKillPassword - transmitted Kill Code
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

       throws STException

        1 byte tag's response

        STException

      • presentPwd

        byte presentPwd(byte passwordNumber,
                byte[] password)
         throws STException
        Present Password command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet In case of success, the security session associated to the password is opened (command code 0xB3)
        Parameters:
        passwordNumber - number of the password
        password - array of bytes containing password value
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • lockSector

        byte lockSector(byte blockAddress,
                byte securityStatus)
         throws STException
        Lock Sector command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Lock specified sector (command code 0xB2)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Block address contained in the sector to be locked
        securityStatus - Read and Write access right for locked sector
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

        blockAddress - Address of the block to read
        Returns:

        byte[] fastReadMultipleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                             byte nbrOfBlocks)
                      throws STException
        Fast Read Multiple Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0xC3) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to read
        nbrOfBlocks - The number of blocks to be read minus one
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

        byte[] fastExtendedReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress)
                            throws STException
        Fast Extended Read Single Block command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Read the content of one extended memory blocks (command code 0xC4) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to read (2 bytes address, LSByte MSByte)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • fastExtendedReadMultipleBlock

                                     byte[] nbrOfBlocks)

        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to read (2 bytes address LSByte MSByte)
        nbrOfBlocks - The number of blocks to be read minus one
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeEHCfg

        byte writeEHCfg(byte data,
                byte flag,
                byte[] uid)
         throws STException
        Write EHCfg command as defined in M24LR specification Update Energy Harvesting configuration register (command code 0xA1)
        Parameters:
        data - Data to write
        flag - 1 byte request flag
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

        Parameters:

        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:

        byte setRstEHEn(byte data,
                byte flag,
                byte[] uid)
         throws STException
        SetRstEHEn command as defined in M24LR specification Enable (set) or Disable (reset) Energy Harvesting (command code 0xA2)
        Parameters:
        data - Data to write
        flag - 1 byte request flag
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        checkEnable data response
        Throws:
        STException

      • manageGpo

        byte manageGpo(byte value,
               byte flag,
               byte[] uid)
        throws STException
        Manage GPO command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet Depending on parameter, sends interrupt or force gpo value (command code 0xA9)
        Parameters:
        value - GPOVAL parameter configuration
        flag - 1 byte request flag
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • enableUntraceableMode

        byte enableUntraceableMode(byte[] obfuscatedUntraceableModePassword)
                    throws STException
        Enable Untraceable Mode command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will not respond to any command except Present Password and Get Random Number (command number 0xBA)
        Parameters:
        obfuscatedUntraceableModePassword - Crypted Untraceable Mode password
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • inventoryInitiated

        byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag)
                   throws STException
        Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte with the inventory command's request flag
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • inventoryInitiated

        byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag,
                          byte afiField)
                   throws STException
        Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte with the inventory command's request flag
        afiField - 1-byte AFI value
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • inventoryInitiated

        byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag,
                          byte maskLengthInBits,
                          byte[] maskValue)
                   throws STException
        Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte with the inventory command's request flag
        maskLengthInBits - 1 byte for the anti-collision mask length
        maskValue - Should contains number of bytes according to maskLengthInBits value in bytes
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • inventoryInitiated

        byte[] inventoryInitiated(byte flag,
                          byte maskLengthInBits,
                          byte[] maskValue,
                          byte afiField)
                   throws STException
        Inventory Initiated command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag must have received an Initiate or Fast Initiate command to run the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD1)
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte with the inventory command's request flag
        maskLengthInBits - 1 byte for the anti-collision mask length
        maskValue - Should contains number of bytes according to maskLengthInBits value
        afiField - 1-byte AFI value
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

             throws STException
        Fast Initiate command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag runs the anticollision sequence (command code 0xD2) The rf reader must support fast responses format from the tag
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte request flag
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • inventoryRead

        byte[] inventoryRead(byte flag,
                     byte blockAddress,
                     byte nbrOfBlocks)
              throws STException
        Inventory Read command as defined in STMicroelectronics datasheet The tag will perform the Anticollision sequence and sends back read data in the same response (command code 0xD3)
        Parameters:
        flag - 1 byte with the inventory command's request flag
        blockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        nbrOfBlocks - Number of blocks to be read minus one
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException
